tips: Engage in regular aerobic exercise, like brisk walking or cycling, for at least 30 minutes most days of the week.
Consume a heart-healthy diet high in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins while limiting saturated and trans fats.
Monitor your blood pressure and cholesterol levels regularly and follow your doctor's recommendations for managing them.
Reduce stress through relaxation techniques, such as deep breathing exercises or yoga.
Avoid smoking and limit alcohol intake to lower your risk of heart disease.
Protect your eyes from UV radiation by wearing sunglasses with UV-blocking lenses when outdoors.
Follow the 20-20-20 rule: Every 20 minutes, take a 20-second break, and focus on something at least 20 feet away to reduce eye strain.
Quit smoking to lower the risk of eye diseases like cataracts and macular degeneration.
Maintain a balanced diet rich in foods high in vitamins A, C, and E, as well as zinc and omega-3 fatty acids.
Get regular eye exams to detect and address vision issues or eye diseases early.
